Figure 2:Overview ofThoughtComm. At each communication roundtt, agents encode their model statesHt(i)H_{t}^{(i)}into a shared latent space via a sparsity-regularized autoencoder, yielding latent thoughtsZ^t\hat{Z}_{t}. Each dimensionZ^t,j\hat{Z}_{t,j}is selectively routed to relevant agents based on the recovered dependency structure, allowing agents to identify both shared and private thoughts for reasoning. The corresponding latent thoughts are then injected into each agent model via prefix adaptation to guide the next response. These updated responses form the input to the next round, enabling multi-agent collaboration beyond purely message exchange.
